info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 24 at 2:45PM HST until January 25 at 12:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY EXTENDED UNTIL MIDNIGHT HST TONIGHT FOR OAHU MOLOKAI LANAI AND FOR LOWER TONIGHT ELEVATIONS ON MAUI... ...HIGH WIND WARNING FOR MAUNA KEA AND MAUNA LOA SUMMITS UNTIL 6 PM HST THURSDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY CANCELLED FOR KAUAI AND NIIHAU... .Strong and gusty southwest winds are expected through this evening in the lower elevations of Oahu and Maui County as a cold front passes. Winds will be strongest in and near heavy showers, and where terrain most accelerates the flow over the north and east side of the islands, and over the central portions of Oahu and Maui. Over the Big Island Summits, west winds will continue to increase through the evening, becoming dangerously strong tonight. ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT HST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts over 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of Lanai, Molokai, Oahu, and lower elevations of Maui. * WHEN...Until midnight HST tonight. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can tear off shingles, knock down tree branches, blow away tents and awnings and make it difficult to steer, especially for drivers of high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Watch out for falling tree branches when walking or driving. Make sure tents and awnings are secure or take them down. Be prepared for power outages.
